issues.description: Course cards in search results and category pages do not display availability or enrollment status. Users cannot tell whether a course is currently open, upcoming, or archived without clicking through to the detail page, causing frustration and wasted navigation.
issues.evidence: Smashing Magazine audit found course cards lack key status information, forcing unnecessary clicks to determine availability.

issues.description: Category pages displaying 100+ courses lack adequate filtering and sorting options. Users cannot efficiently narrow down results by level, duration, language, or availability, making course discovery overwhelming on pages with large result sets.
issues.evidence: Category pages with 100+ items had limited filtering, forcing users to scroll through extensive lists.

issues.description: The registration form uses a dropdown-only country selector without text input or search functionality. Users must scroll through a long alphabetical list of 200+ countries to find their selection, which is slow and error-prone.
issues.evidence: Dropdown with 200+ countries and no type-ahead search, identified as friction point in registration flow.

issues.description: The password field during registration and login lacks a visibility toggle option. Users cannot verify their typed password, leading to increased error rates especially on mobile devices.
issues.evidence: No show/hide password toggle present in form fields.

issues.element: Form field labels and required indicators
issues.description: Required form fields during registration are not clearly marked with visual indicators such as asterisks or color differentiation. Users cannot distinguish between required and optional fields before attempting submission.
issues.evidence: Form fields lack asterisks or other required field indicators, leading to validation errors on submission.

issues.description: Google PageSpeed Insights score of 12 out of 100 on search results pages indicates severely degraded performance. Slow page loads lead to user abandonment, especially on mobile connections, and undermine the browsing experience.
issues.evidence: PageSpeed score of 12/100 documented in Smashing Magazine audit. Critical performance bottleneck.

issues.description: The user dashboard provides minimal progress tracking for enrolled courses. Learners cannot easily see their completion percentage, upcoming deadlines, or learning streaks, reducing motivation and making it hard to manage multiple enrollments.
issues.evidence: Dashboard lacks comprehensive progress indicators, completion tracking, and learning analytics for enrolled courses.

issues.description: The 'Explore Courses' call-to-action button has inconsistent styling across different pages and sections. Color, size, and placement vary, breaking visual consistency and making it harder for users to build reliable interaction patterns.
issues.evidence: Button styling for primary CTA varies across homepage, category pages, and course detail pages.

issues.description: Once a username is chosen during registration, it cannot be changed in account settings. Users who made typos or want to update their display name have no recourse, which is a violation of user control and freedom.
issues.evidence: Username field is locked after initial registration with no option to modify, as noted in the audit.
